paragraphs.content: Chapter 8
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 8

paragraphs.content: Doth not wisdom cry? and understanding put forth her voice?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Doth not wisdom cry? and understanding put forth her voice?

paragraphs.content: She standeth in the top of high places, by the way in the places of the paths.
paragraphs.contentHtml: She standeth in the top of high places, by the way in the places of the paths.

paragraphs.content: She crieth at the gates, at the entry of the city, at the coming in at the doors.
paragraphs.contentHtml: She crieth at the gates, at the entry of the city, at the coming in at the doors.

paragraphs.content: Unto you, O men, I call; and my voice is to the sons of man.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Unto you, O men, I call; and my voice is to the sons of man.

paragraphs.content: O ye simple, understand wisdom: and, ye fools, be ye of an understanding heart.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O ye simple, understand wisdom: and, ye fools, be ye of an understanding heart.

paragraphs.content: Hear; for I will speak of excellent things; and the opening of my lips shall be right things.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hear; for I will speak of excellent things; and the opening of my lips shall be right things.

paragraphs.content: For my mouth shall speak truth; and wickedness is an abomination to my lips.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For my mouth shall speak truth; and wickedness is an abomination to my lips.

paragraphs.content: All the words of my mouth are in righteousness; there is nothing froward or perverse in them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: All the words of my mouth are in righteousness; there is nothing froward or perverse in them.

paragraphs.content: They are all plain to him that understandeth, and right to them that find knowledge.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They are all plain to him that understandeth, and right to them that find knowledge.

paragraphs.content: Receive my instruction, and not silver; and knowledge rather than choice gold.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Receive my instruction, and not silver; and knowledge rather than choice gold.

paragraphs.content: For wisdom is better than rubies; and all the things that may be desired are not to be compared to it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For wisdom is better than rubies; and all the things that may be desired are not to be compared to it.

paragraphs.content: I wisdom dwell with prudence, and find out knowledge of witty inventions.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I wisdom dwell with prudence, and find out knowledge of witty inventions.

paragraphs.content: The fear of the LORD is to hate evil: pride, and arrogancy, and the evil way, and the froward mouth, do I hate.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The fear of the Lord is to hate evil: pride, and arrogancy, and the evil way, and the froward mouth, do I hate.

paragraphs.content: Counsel is mine, and sound wisdom: I am understanding; I have strength.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Counsel is mine, and sound wisdom: I am understanding; I have strength.

paragraphs.content: By me kings reign, and princes decree justice.
paragraphs.contentHtml: By me kings reign, and princes decree justice.

paragraphs.content: By me princes rule, and nobles, even all the judges of the earth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: By me princes rule, and nobles, even all the judges of the earth.

paragraphs.content: I love them that love me; and those that seek me early shall find me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I love them that love me; and those that seek me early shall find me.

paragraphs.content: Riches and honour are with me; yea, durable riches and righteousness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Riches and honour are with me; yea, durable riches and righteousness.

paragraphs.content: My fruit is better than gold, yea, than fine gold; and my revenue than choice silver.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My fruit is better than gold, yea, than fine gold; and my revenue than choice silver.

paragraphs.content: I lead in the way of righteousness, in the midst of the paths of judgment:
paragraphs.contentHtml: I lead in the way of righteousness, in the midst of the paths of judgment:

paragraphs.content: That I may cause those that love me to inherit substance; and I will fill their treasures.
paragraphs.contentHtml: That I may cause those that love me to inherit substance; and I will fill their treasures.

paragraphs.content: The LORD possessed me in the beginning of his way, before his works of old.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The Lord possessed me in the beginning of his way, before his works of old.

paragraphs.content: I was set up from everlasting, from the beginning, or ever the earth was.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I was set up from everlasting, from the beginning, or ever the earth was.

paragraphs.content: When there were no depths, I was brought forth; when there were no fountains abounding with water.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When there were no depths, I was brought forth; when there were no fountains abounding with water.

paragraphs.content: Before the mountains were settled, before the hills was I brought forth:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Before the mountains were settled, before the hills was I brought forth:

paragraphs.content: While as yet he had not made the earth, nor the fields, nor the highest part of the dust of the world.
paragraphs.contentHtml: While as yet he had not made the earth, nor the fields, nor the highest part of the dust of the world.

paragraphs.content: When he prepared the heavens, I was there: when he set a compass upon the face of the depth:
paragraphs.contentHtml: When he prepared the heavens, I was there: when he set a compass upon the face of the depth:

paragraphs.content: When he established the clouds above: when he strengthened the fountains of the deep:
paragraphs.contentHtml: When he established the clouds above: when he strengthened the fountains of the deep:

paragraphs.content: When he gave to the sea his decree, that the waters should not pass his commandment: when he appointed the foundations of the earth:
paragraphs.contentHtml: When he gave to the sea his decree, that the waters should not pass his commandment: when he appointed the foundations of the earth:

paragraphs.content: Then I was by him, as one brought up with him: and I was daily his delight, rejoicing always before him;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then I was by him, as one brought up with him: and I was daily his delight, rejoicing always before him;

paragraphs.content: Rejoicing in the habitable part of his earth; and my delights were with the sons of men.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Rejoicing in the habitable part of his earth; and my delights were with the sons of men.

paragraphs.content: Now therefore hearken unto me, O ye children: for blessed are they that keep my ways.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Now therefore hearken unto me, O ye children: for blessed are they that keep my ways.

paragraphs.content: Hear instruction, and be wise, and refuse it not.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hear instruction, and be wise, and refuse it not.

paragraphs.content: Blessed is the man that heareth me, watching daily at my gates, waiting at the posts of my doors.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Blessed is the man that heareth me, watching daily at my gates, waiting at the posts of my doors.

paragraphs.content: For whoso findeth me findeth life, and shall obtain favour of the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For whoso findeth me findeth life, and shall obtain favour of the Lord.

paragraphs.content: But he that sinneth against me wrongeth his own soul: all they that hate me love death.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But he that sinneth against me wrongeth his own soul: all they that hate me love death.
